pull.title: [wallet] [refactor] Simplify getbalance implementation

events.body:
> I could imagine a follow-up refactoring that get rid of all the individual caches...

I also think this could be good to unify/organize these. #9167 adds two more caches, so they could be integrated as well.

Rebased 4b49ed65ede769617eab048e4bbab6d5219600c6 -> e8ce6a4877186940e95e67aeaa12fd11a23b1e0d ([getbalance-cleanup.0](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/getbalance-cleanup.0) -> [getbalance-cleanup.1](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/getbalance-cleanup.1)), fixing trivial merge conflict with #9613.

issue.title: negative balance
issue.body:
### Describe the issue

### Can you reliably reproduce the issue?
#### If so, please list the steps to reproduce below:
`bitcoin-cli getbalance '*' `
and 
`bitcoin-cli listaccounts`

### Expected behaviour
same as **bitcoin-cli getbalance** 
the result is **61.65250439**

### Actual behaviour
```
bitcoin-cli getbalance '*'
-14.03410034
```

```
bitcoin-cli listaccounts
{
  "": -14.03410034
}
```

### Screenshots.
If the issue is related to the GUI, screenshots can be added to this issue via drag & drop.

### What version of bitcoin-core are you using?
  "version": 130200,
  "protocolversion": 70015,
  "walletversion": 130000,

### Machine specs:
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- CPU: 4
- RAM: 8Gb
- Disk size: 200Gb
- Disk Type (HD/SDD): SSD

events.body: Rebased e8ce6a4877186940e95e67aeaa12fd11a23b1e0d -> be74f34671ac89feaafe80b3ac43ff108c9ceb29 ([getbalance-cleanup.1](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/getbalance-cleanup.1) -> [getbalance-cleanup.2](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/getbalance-cleanup.2)) because of conflict with #9764.

Rebased be74f34671ac89feaafe80b3ac43ff108c9ceb29 -> 0b9520d1fb242864b8bd3f6ec68fa91b231467df ([pr/getbalance-cleanup.2](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/getbalance-cleanup.2) -> [pr/getbalance-cleanup.3](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/getbalance-cleanup.3)) because of conflicts with pwalletMain renames in #9775.

events.message:
[wallet] Add GetLegacyBalance method to simplify getbalance RPC

This adds a simpler new implementation of getbalance logic along with asserts
to confirm it behaves identically to the old logic. The old logic is removed in
the next commit.

events.body:
No problem, thanks for the review!

Rebased 0b9520d1fb242864b8bd3f6ec68fa91b231467df -> 02d9f50d5f3c96fe888c230d59c5afdab4c7c6a3 ([pr/getbalance-cleanup.3](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/getbalance-cleanup.3) -> [pr/getbalance-cleanup.4](https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commits/pr/getbalance-cleanup.4)). No changes except adding another `std::` prefix and passing the right new argument to the `CWalletDB` constructor.

issue.title: Wallet: correctly deprecate accounts in getbalance, re-add minconf / include-watch-only
issue.body:
It looks like that #9614 accidentally(?) dropped support for `min-conf` and `watch_only` in `getbalance()`.

This PR tries to correctly deprecate accounts in `getbalance()` following the dummy-argument approach.

issue.title: [Tracking] Remove wallet 'account' API
issue.body:
This is a tracking issue for the removal of the wallet's built-in 'account' API, which is clunky, error-prone, and already marked deprecated. An earlier issue (#1248) outlined the general timeline plan for this removal, this issue will track actionable changes required for each stage.

Stage 1 (v4.0.1 Jan 13 2020, *completed*):
 - [x] [RPC] Notate all account stuff as deprecated (#1251)

Stage 2 (v4.2.0 TBA, *completed* #1731):
 - [x] Rename account to label where appropriate (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11536)
 - [x] Simplify getbalance implementation (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9614)
 - [x] Give RPC commands more information about the RPC request (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8788)
 - [x] Introduce 'label' API for wallet (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12892)
 - [x] Disable account RPC functions by default. Wallet functional tests updated to use -deprecatedrpc=accounts to maintain existing behaviour (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12953)
 - [x] Remove `getlabeladdress` intermediary RPC method (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13060)
 - [x] Add filter option to listreceivedbyaddress (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9991)
 - [x] Remove 'account' API from wallet functional tests (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13075)
 - [x] Fixups from account API deprecation (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13498)

Stage 3 (v5.0.0 TBA, *pending*):
 - [ ] Fully remove the 'account' API (ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13825 = https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/c9c32e6b844fc79467b7e24c6c916142a0d08484)

issue.title: Fix for "sendmany" RPC call insufficient funds message
issue.body:
## PR intention
Fix an issue with deprecated account system preventing `sendtomany` RPC call from working in some cases

## Code changes brief
Merged bitcoin PR #9614
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9614
On top of this added a check for first parameter of `sendmany`. Made changes to do not use account system while processing RPC if the first parameter is empty.

comments.body: I think this results in no longer throwing `RPC_WALLET_INVALID_ACCOUNT_NAME` when someone tries to get balance of `"*"`, instead, it returns back the total balance. But I think this is what we want....
Yes, this is just keeping the current behavior (line 698 before this commit, which is removed in the next commit).
